description: Number of perfect squares, k^2, where k^2 <= n and GCD(k,n) = 1.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Only 2 squares, 1 and 9, are <= 14 and relatively prime to 14. So a(14) = 2.
prog: (Haskell)a057828 x = length $ filter ((== 1) . (gcd x)) $                     takeWhile (<= x) $ tail a000290_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 22 2012
author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 08 2000
